channel.title: PC Branding
channel.description:
I want to be able to brand the pcs built in the workshop with the company logo, I have the registry side working fine, however it is the copying of the logo which fails, every time i get "Access Denied" when trying to copy. I then thought about copying it into the user directory however i then would come across the problem of telling the registry where the logo is stored.
here is my codes, do you have any ideas?
[code]xcopy .\OEMLogo.bmp C:\\Windows\\System32\\ /s /a OEMLogo.reg pause[/code]
[code]Windows Registry Editor Version 5.00
[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\OEMInformation] "Logo"="C:\\Windows\\System32\\OEMLogo.bmp" "Manufactuter"="TPSL" "SupportHours"="09:00-17:30" "SupportURL"="http://www.tpsl.co.uk" "SupportPhone"="(01423) 881 888"[/code]
edit: nvm, used %userprofile% instead

item.title: PC Branding
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

newbiehacker:

System32 is inaccessible unless you have admin privileges. If running on windows 7 or vista, right-click your batch file and run as administrator

Holy fucking grave dig, but I guess for the sake of answering the question

Read full topic

item.description:
@newbiehacker wrote:

System32 is inaccessible unless you have admin privileges. If running on windows 7 or vista, right-click your batch file and run as administrator

item.title: PC Branding
item.dc:creator: @GothKing5000 GothKing5000
item.description:
@GothKing5000 wrote:

Try using xcopy32 and adding -r to your command should overwrite read only files…
and maybe even -h cause its a system file.

http://support.microsoft.com/kb/289483

Read full topic

item.title: PC Branding
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

I want to be able to brand the pcs built in the workshop with the company logo, I have the registry side working fine, however it is the copying of the logo which fails, every time i get “Access Denied” when trying to copy. I then thought about copying it into the user directory however i then would come across the problem of telling the registry where the logo is stored.

here is my codes, do you have any ideas?

xcopy .\OEMLogo.bmp C:\\Windows\\System32\\ /s /a OEMLogo.reg pause

[code]Windows Registry Editor Version 5.00

[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\OEMInformation]
“Logo”=“C:\Windows\System32\OEMLogo.bmp”
“Manufactuter”=“TPSL”
“SupportHours”=“09:00-17:30”
“SupportURL”=“http://www.tpsl.co.uk”
“SupportPhone”="(01423) 881 888"[/code]

edit: nvm, used %userprofile% instead

Read full topic
